::: {.question} **Covenant Step-Up — Present Value of Incremental Coupons** The company issued a debt of R$1,000. The annual coupon for the first two years is 9.9% per year. However, starting from the third year, the coupon increases (step-up) by 1.8% per year, reaching a total of 11.7% in years 3 to 5. The discount rate for the cash flows is 8.1% per year. Based on the coupon step-up from the third year, calculate the present value (R$) of the incremental coupons due to the step-up in years 3 to 5, discounted at the given rate of 9%. The debt structure details are as follows: face value of R$1,000, base coupon rate of 9.9% per year, step-up of 1.8% in years 3 to 5, and a discount rate of 8.1% per year. Compute the **present value (R$)** of the **incremental coupons** due to the step-up in years 3–5, discounted at the given rate. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Increment per year: \(R$ 18\). \(PV = \sum_{t=3}^{5} \frac{R$ 18}{(1+0.081)^t} \approx \) R$ 39.62.
::: :::
